text: When internet connectivity issues impact the end users of
your application, you want to be notified fast. And because
they connect to your app through multiple internet providers, it's
difficult to diagnose the root cause of the issue.
With Amazon CloudWatch Internet Monitor. You can
quickly identify the cause of performance issues saving valuable
response time. Using Amazon CloudWatch
Internet Monitor, learn about problems that
arise on the internet that your end users are experiencing at
different geographic locations and networks - without
writing a single line of code.
It also provides insights and recommendations to help
improve your end user's experience by comparing your
current performance with estimated performance from other AWS
services. And it also suggests Regions
for placing your workloads to get the best internet performance
based on your user traffic profiles.
You can see a global view of traffic patterns and health events
and
easily drill down into information about past events
at different geographic granularities.
To support your integrations with other tools, internet monitor
provides logs on the geographies and networks specific
to your application in Amazon CloudWatch logs.
It can also deliver internet health notifications through
Amazon EventBridge. If the
problem is on the AWS Network, notifications on
the AWS Health dashboard let you know what steps AWS
is taking to mitigate the issue. So whether
you're a small scale startup or an enterprise-size business,
Amazon CloudWatch Internet Monitor helps you
proactively monitor the performance and availability of
your application.
